summary: This is a job description for an AI Engineer II (Remote - US) at BNSF Railway. The role involves designing, developing, and implementing AI models and algorithms for railroad operations, including predictive maintenance, scheduling, and safety monitoring. Key responsibilities also include data collection and analysis, optimization, automation, testing, and collaboration with cross-functional teams. The position requires a minimum of 3 years of experience in AI/ML development, proficiency in Python or Java, and familiarity with various data engineering tools and machine learning frameworks.
key_points: Design, develop, and implement AI models and algorithms for railroad operations (predictive maintenance, scheduling, safety monitoring).
Collect, preprocess, and clean data; build and maintain ETL pipelines for AI applications.
Optimize train scheduling, route planning, and fuel efficiency using AI-driven solutions.
Participate in testing and validation of AI models to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and business analysts.
Minimum 3 years experience in AI/ML development, data science, or software engineering.
Familiarity with data engineering tools (Hadoop, Spark, AWS S3, PySpark, RDS, JupyterLab) and cloud services (AWS, Azure, Databricks).
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Keras) and SQL.
Preferred: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, AI, Data Science, or Engineering.
Benefits include 401(k), Railroad Retirement, comprehensive health care, HSA, life/disability insurance, family benefits, annual bonus, and generous leave.

Experience Required: Minimum of 3 years experience in AI/ML development, data science, software engineering
Preferred Education: Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Engineering

raw_text_preview:
AI Engineer II (Remote - US)
Location REMOTE, US, 76131Job Id 94808Company Name BNSF Railway

be part of a team that values safety, inclusion, and excellence
we are one of the largest U.S. railroads transporting the nation’s freight across 28 western states and 3 Canadian provinces. as a member of our team, you will play a role in supporting the movement of essential products and materials that help feed, clothe, supply, and power communities throughout America and the world.
 
bnsf | tech: innovating and transforming the future of freight rail
bnsf | tech is the technology division making BNSF the preeminent freight and mobility company in north america.
 
are you ready to drive change?
if you are passionate about making a difference and eager to advance your career in a dynamic and supportive environment, we want you on our team! join us in reshaping the future of freight rail and discover a fulfilling career where your contributions matter.
 
we are committed to a culture where all employees are included, belong, and have equal opportunity to achieve their full potential. Come make a difference with us!
 
learn more about BNSF and our Benefits
 
Job Location: Remote US
Anticipated Start Date: 03/30/2026

The US base salary range for this full-time position is provided below:


Salary Range: $123,750 - $175,000

The range represents the amount bnsf | tech reasonably expects to pay for the position based on the level, scope, and responsibilities of the role. Individual compensation and level of position offered is determined by the hiring location and additional factors including but not limited to job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. In addition to base pay and bonus eligibility, BNSF offers a comprehensive benefits package.
 
This is a full-time remote position. Employees may work from anywhere within the contiguous 48 states of the United States

Travel is up to 20%. Employees will be required to occasionally travel to our corporate headquarters in Fort Worth, TX for in person meetings. Travel expenses for business needs will be covered by BNSF

This position is open to candidates who are currently authorized to work in the United States. We are also open to sponsoring H-1B transfers, TN nonimmigrant status, and STEM OPT candidates with at least 2 years of remaining eligibility.

Apply early as this job may be removed or filled prior to the closing date, which is approximately seven (7) days after the posting date.

data & ai: lead our charge into the future as an ai company by transforming our data assets into a real time enterprise.

Key responsibilities may include:

AI Development and Implementation:

Assist in designing, developing, and implementing AI models and algorithms tailored to railroad operations, including predictive maintenance, scheduling, and safety monitoring.

Collaborate with senior engineers to apply machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets and extract actionable insights.

Data Collection and Analysis:

Collect, preprocess, and clean data from various sources (e.g., sensors, GPS, maintenance logs) for training AI models.

Conduct exploratory data analysis to identify trends and patterns relevant to rail operations.

Building and maintaining Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) pipelines for AI applications.

Optimization and Automation:

Work in partnership with data scientists to develop AI-driven solutions to optimize train scheduling, route planning, and fuel efficiency.

Support the deployment of automation tools for monitoring and managing railroad systems.

Testing and Validation:

Participate in testing and optimization of AI models to ensure accuracy, reliability, and compliance with safety standards.

Monitor model performance and assist in troubleshooting issues as they arise.

Collaboration and Communication:

Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, business analysts, to understand their needs and enable AI-driven solutions.

Communicate technical concepts and project updates to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Continuous Learning and Development:
with advancements in AI, machine learning, and railroad technologies.

Participate in training sessions, workshops, and conferences to enhance skills and knowledge.

The duties and responsibilities in this posting are representative categories to be used in deciding whether to apply for this position. This is not an exhaustive list of the position’s duties. 
 
At BNSF Railway, we encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, showcasing their skills, experiences and development. We provide resources and tools to help you reach your full potential, fostering a supportive and inclusive environment.

Basic Qualifications

Authorized to work in the US.
Minimum of 3 years experience in AI/ML development, data science, software engineering, or relevant experience.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Java.
Familiarity with data engineering tools and platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, EMS, AWS S3, PySpark, RDS, JupyterLab) and cloud services (AWS, Azure, Databricks) and open source environments.
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Keras).
Understanding of databases and SQL for data management.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex datasets.
Teamwork: Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Communication: Effective verbal and written communication skills
 
Preferred Qualifications

Able to work now and in the future without BNSF’s assistance (whether monetary, through sponsorship, or otherwise) in obtaining, maintaining, or extending employment authorization (including H-1B, STEM OPT/CPT, or TN nonimmigrant status).
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Engineering, or related field.
Basic knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, TIBCO)
Experience with IoT devices, sensors, or edge computing in industrial environments.
Experience with GIS data.
Knowledge of railroad operations or transportation systems.
Familiarity with predictive maintenance and anomaly detection techniques.
Internship or academic projects related to AI or machine learning.
 
At BNSF, you will have access to a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including:

An industry-leading 401(k) and renowned Railroad Retirement program.
A range of robust health care options for you and your dependents (including domestic partners), including medical, dental, vision, telemedicine, mental health, cancer support, and high-quality care network options.
Health care spending accounts (HSA) with employer contributions, as well as life and disability insurance, provided at no cost.
Family benefits including parental, pediatric and family building support, adoption and surrogacy reimbursement, and dependent care spending account (with employer match).
Access to discounts on travel, gym memberships, counseling services and wellness support.
Annual bonus (Incentive Compensation Program)
Generous leave / time off policies.
For more information, visit Benefits.
Please be aware of potential fraud that can occur when searching for new career opportunities. Please review our FAQ for more information and awareness.

All positions require pre-employment background verification.

BNSF Railway is an Equal Opportunity Employer, all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
